website_summaries.verdict: The Vionic Morris is equipped with an EVA insole that provides underfoot support and comfort. The top is crafted from mesh for breathability and PU overlays that define its shape. Meanwhile, the bottom is lined with rubber for reliable traction. Overall, this pair of Vionic walking shoes has been the go-to everyday walking shoe for those who experience foot pains.
pros: The Vionic Morris impresses almost all of the people who use it because of the comfort it offers
Many owners are satisfied with the arch support in this walking shoe
A lot of reviewers describe it as a miracle trainer because it relieved foot and leg pain brought about by various conditions
The use of light materials on this model resonates well with multiple shoppers
According to more than a few wearers, this footwear is suitable during warm weather because it is breathable
The aesthetic of this footgear delights a bunch of buyers
cons: Several users have complained that the Vionic Morris is challenging to put on because of the bootie-like construction
Some folks wish the laces could be adjusted to tighten the fit at the midfoot

customer_reviews.title: Can convert to conservative look.
customer_reviews.text: Wife liked hers bought on friends testimonial. I’m old and fat and needed the width with support 240 lbs. Great choice. Had local boot shop paint the blue elastic closers black and wear to work. On feet a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W. Monday

customer_reviews.title: Another great pair of Vionic shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have become a big fan of Vionic shoes. The support is fantastic. I needed to replace a pair of Nike's, so I went for these. I'm very happy with the fit and comfort. I was uncertain about the bungee laces, but they work fine.
customer_reviews.author: RNM

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. The arch was just to high for what I wanted, and you cannot tell that without trying it on. The shoe is high quality and build well. Good shoe, I just was looking for less of an arch. Thank you. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: David Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, these are a must if you have had problems with plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.author: Ross and Monica Cook

customer_reviews.title: Vionic shoes are not comfortable after wearing all day.
customer_reviews.text: The high arch hurt my feet and I was sore after walking for 5 hours in these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: STS 51

customer_reviews.title: OMGosh These Shoes Are Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable with great arch support. I love that they slip on but do not look like slip on shoes. They fit so good I’m buying another pair in different color.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL E. ZEHR

customer_reviews.title: Questionable
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t really used these yet, but I question if these were brand new sneakers. They did not come in the original box and there was no stuffing in the sneakers or paper around them. Also there were no paperwork or tags that always comes with any of my other vionic footwear. Maybe they were “try ons “ from a shoe store. I believe this should have been advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Grottole

customer_reviews.title: I returned them.
customer_reviews.text: They feel great to walk in but after 1 week started to come unglued. I shipped them back. Got some Dansko shoes and the comfort and build quality are second to none. Don't expect longevity from these vionics.
customer_reviews.author: Matzvey

customer_reviews.title: I Use Them As Slippers
customer_reviews.text: Would have rated them 5 stars. The box said the right size but the shoes inside were one size larger and marked one size larger. It works out since I’m using them for slippers and they slip on and off easy. I have high arches and these work really well for me. Being home for days lately my feet were hurting with memory foam slippers. That was corrected a couple of days after wearing these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Greg V

customer_reviews.title: Great support for everyday
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a casual athletic shoe for office days to wear with jeans with enough support for all day but not a clunky hiking shoe or heavy cross trainer. The Vionic fits well and supported all day, feet weren't tired or achy at the end of the day. The laces don't adjust but the fit was still firm without being tight. They are a little snug when you first put them on but comfortable all day.
customer_reviews.author: Jack S

customer_reviews.title: Great support while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: Very supportive, but wore out within three months. Tread coming apart and the arch support collapsed. Very disappointed compared to my previous Vionic purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah S.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for walking long distances
customer_reviews.text: I need orthotic shoes for work. I am on my feet for 4 hours , but these shoes did nothing to help my plantar fasciitis. The diamond shapes on the soles peels off along the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Better support, in the right spot
customer_reviews.text: These are better than my Superfeet inserts. My wife found them and I tried them with great results. Support is a little further back than Superfeet and a little higher. Made a huge difference. I will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Art vR

customer_reviews.title: Fit Great, Feel Great
customer_reviews.text: Wore them for a walk two days ago and my tootsies feel great!
customer_reviews.author: MalcolmG

customer_reviews.title: It must be a hipster shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 3 pairs of different Vionic shoes after buying one pair. Could not get my foot into the shoe because the opening around the ankle is too small
customer_reviews.author: RJP

customer_reviews.title: Standsrd size standards not adhered to.
customer_reviews.text: Wear size 8. At 69 years one would think I know my size! Shoe was one size small could not even shoe horn in. Label says size 8. Either mislsbelled or they have quality control issues.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Subbarayan

customer_reviews.title: Sizes are accurate.
customer_reviews.text: After a month of use they are great. I just wonder about them getting too loose and no way to tighten.
customer_reviews.author: Germansen

customer_reviews.title: may want to buy a bigger size then needed.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was to small to even fit on foot. Wear a 9 and bought a 9 but couldn't even get my toes into them.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica & Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the fit and support these shoes give him.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: They are a perfect fit and look great had lots of compliments
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my husband who had heel pain. He says the are great! He doesn’t have heel pain and is able to walk better.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Free

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for 1 month!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the shoes for the first 30 days and then they started to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: Always liked the vionic brand, this pair lives up to the vionic reputation. I was worried that the shoe would be too loose as it lacks the traditional laces, but it fits great and saves me time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Arches
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit well, give good support, and are comfortable when walking.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Millson

customer_reviews.title: On the narrow side.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very smart looking. Due to the pointier shape of the shoes, they unfortunately weren't wide enought for my brother.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi Posejpal

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: My son says the toe area is slightly snug. Will they stretch out?
customer_reviews.author: Krista Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Fit's well, arch support in correct place
customer_reviews.text: This was to replace another pair where the arch support was too far back in the shoe, making them uncomfortable. This shoe is VERY comfortable. And I appreciate that it is a slip on sneaker!
customer_reviews.author: KathMcP

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but the sole eventually becomes unglued every time
customer_reviews.text: Update: comfortable shoes but don't expect them to last. I've owned numerous pair and the sole bottoms become unglued. I've noticed that it starts separating around two months of wear and gets worse from there. Sad, because they are comfortable and look stylish for being an orthopedic shoe.
customer_reviews.author: amazonbuyer

product_meta.title: Vionic Men's Fulton Morris Slip On Sneaker - Casual Walking Shoes for Men with Concealed Orthotic Arch Support
product_meta.description: A polished monochrome motif accented by contrasting bungee laces and soft neoprene and mesh uppers keep you looking sharp in every situation.
feature_bullets: Mesh and Man-made Upper. Removable Mesh Covered EVA Footbed. Durable Rubber Outsole. Received American Podiatric Medical Association Seal of Acceptance.
YOUR NEW FAVORITE SNEAKERS: A polished monochrome motif accented by contrasting bungee laces and soft neoprene and mesh uppers keep you looking sharp in every situation.
GET ACTIVE: These casual sneakers slip on, and are ideal for everyday wear. They are breathable, lightweight athletic shoes are perfect for walking.

VIO MOTION SUPPORT is concealed within every Vionic shoe, supporting every step from the ground up so you can confidently move in unmatched comfort. Full biomechanical contact hugs your foot's natural curves, providing essential support in all of our casual, dress and active shoes and slippers.
Vionic supports you, so you can Walk. Move. Live.
